decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a powerful control finisher, with a diverse array of multicolored spells to take advantage of its ability. The main strategy is to assemble a variety of answers and threats from different colors, using cards like Bring to Light and Leyline Binding to control the board while generating card advantage. With the flexibility to access powerful spells across multiple colors, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a slower, more controlling game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies and value engines to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of damage and resource advantage. The key strategy involves sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar to Witch's Oven and Mayhem Devil triggers, while also utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and Deadly Dispute to steal and sacrifice enemy creatures. The inclusion of companions like Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an extra layer of consistency and power to the aggressive game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and generate incremental advantages to close out games efficiently.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive and efficient creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents. Using a combination of disruptive spells and powerful threats, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently. The key strategy involves using efficient removal spells to clear the way for aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Unstoppable Slasher. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck's key concept is to apply relentless pressure and outpace the opponent to secure a swift victory.

The key concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing the powerful abilities of Zur, Eternal Schemer to search for and cast various Overlord creatures. The deck aims to disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Vanishing Verse and Fatal Push while ramping up mana with cards like Flicker of Fate and Up the Beanstalk. The inclusion of various Triome lands and Leyline Binding allows for flexibility in mana fixing and locking down opponent's key cards. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the board and outmaneuvering opponents with its efficient removal and creature options.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Blade of the Oni. It utilizes powerful removal spells such as Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board, and has strong finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out games. The deck also features versatile lands like Blightstep Pathway and Mutavault to support its aggressive game plan.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The goal is to deal damage as quickly as possible, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Kumano Faces Kakkazan, and Emberheart Challenger to push for early damage. Cards like Infuriate and Monstrous Rage help boost the damage output, while Reckless Rage and Slickshot Show-Off provide removal options. The deck also includes some utility lands like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins for added versatility. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a powerful companion option to provide additional mana ramp.

This deck focuses on using creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Mayhem Devil to generate value through sacrifice effects, while also disrupting your opponent with cards like Fatal Push and Claim the Firstborn. Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional flexibility and consistency as a companion. The deck seeks to control the board with removal spells and generate incremental advantages through sacrificing creatures and triggering effects like Yagra, Eater of All. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive Rakdos strategy while also providing access to a variety of colors for maximum efficiency.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and combat tricks. With a focus on white weenie creatures and powerful anthem effects like Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and deal large amounts of damage early in the game. Cards like Brave the Elements provide protection for key creatures, while Declaration in Stone offers removal for any potential threats. The inclusion of mana-fixing lands like Cavern of Souls and utility lands like Castle Ardenvale help to support the aggressive game plan.

This deck revolves around quickly cycling through cards to fill up your graveyard and bring back multiple Arclight Phoenixes for repeated aggressive attacks. Using a mix of spells and card draw mechanics, the focus is on speed and efficiency in both offense and defense. With a combination of cheap spells and efficient creatures, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a strong defense. The deck also includes some control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Lotus Field combo as quickly as possible using cards like Thespian's Stage, Vizier of Tumbling Sands, and Hidden Strings, while also utilizing cards like Pore Over the Pages and Archdruid's Charm for card advantage and disruption. The deck includes a variety of lands and mana sources to support the combo, as well as toolbox cards like Dark Petition and Fae of Wishes for added versatility and consistency. Overall, the deck aims to ramp quickly and efficiently into powerful spells like Omniscience and Emergent Ultimatum to overwhelm the opponent.

Utilizing Jegantha as a companion, this aggro Jund deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value and dealing direct damage to the opponent. By combining cards like Cauldron Familiar, Mayhem Devil, and Witch's Oven, the deck creates a loop of sacrificing and dealing damage, while also utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Claim the Firstborn for removal and disruption. The addition of Scavenger's Talent allows for further flexibility in dealing with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents with its aggressive and synergistic gameplay.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by utilizing efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent early in the game, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Eidolon of the Great Revel to keep the opponent on the back foot. Lightning Helix and Boros Charm provide versatile removal and reach, while cards like Boltwave and Play with Fire allow for additional burn damage. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The key concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. The deck aims to apply pressure with creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Aven Interrupter, while using cards like Collected Company to find additional threats. Shefet Dunes and Werefox Bodyguard provide ways to pump up the team for a strong alpha strike, and Anointed Peacekeeper offers protection against opposing creature strategies.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing primarily black and red cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board, along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to close out the game quickly with powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester. The mana base is carefully selected to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of basic lands and utility lands to ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main idea of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent with quick and aggressive creatures like Callous Sell-Sword, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger. By combining creatures with powerful spells like Monstrous Rage and Ancestral Anger, you can quickly deal a lot of damage to your opponent. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Turn Inside Out. Using lands like Ramunap Ruins and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance, you can ensure that your creatures are always a threat on the board.

This deck focuses on quickly building up powerful creatures by enchanting them with multiple auras. By utilizing cards like Ethereal Armor, All That Glitters, and Sheltered by Ghosts, the deck can create large threats that can deal significant damage early in the game. The inclusion of Sram, Senior Edificer and Mox Amber helps to draw cards and generate mana to keep up the pressure on the opponent. With the help of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and auras, securing a quick victory.
